title: Mobile optimization, fully-collapsible sidebar, and fix Life Lessons category menu overlay + rename

requirements.text: Optimize the app UI for mobile usage by improving responsive layout, spacing, and touch interactions across the AppShell layout (sidebar + main content) so primary navigation and page content are comfortable to use on small screens.

quotes: Optimize the app for mobile usage

acceptanceCriteria: On screens <= 768px wide, no horizontal scrolling is required on core pages due to layout overflow.
Tap targets for navigation controls (menu button, nav icons/links) meet a minimum 44x44px interactive area (consistent with existing mobile touch-target intent in CSS).
The main content area remains scrollable and usable on mobile; header + navigation do not block access to page content.

requirements.text: Make the sidebar totally collapsible on mobile: provide a mode where the sidebar can be fully hidden (not occupying screen width) and can be opened/closed via a visible menu button; ensure the sidebar does not permanently cover or squeeze the content on small screens.
acceptanceCriteria: On screens <= 768px wide, the sidebar can be fully hidden (0 width or off-canvas) such that the main content uses the full viewport width.
A menu button is available to open the sidebar when it is hidden, and a clear action exists to close it again.
Opening the sidebar on mobile does not cause content to be permanently obscured without an obvious close/dismiss interaction.
On larger screens, current behavior (expanded vs icon-collapsed sidebar) remains functional.

requirements.text: Fix the Life Lessons page so the category/menu options do not overlay and block the videos list; move the categories menu to the top of the screen (as a top filter area) while ensuring the videos are visible and scroll beneath it without being covered (match the problem shown in IMG_2564.png and IMG_2564-1.png).

quotes: The menu options still stay in front of the videos in the life lessons tab.
Make the menu available at the top of the screen for categories so the videos can be seen.
Reference the image attached to see what is wrong now.

acceptanceCriteria: In the Life Lessons page, the filter controls (favorites + category buttons) are positioned at the top and do not obscure the video grid/list while scrolling.
The first row of videos is fully visible and not hidden behind any sticky filter/header elements.
No filter/menu element overlaps the video cards on mobile (verified at typical iPhone viewport widths).

requirements.text: Rename the user-facing 'Life Lessons' label to the new name requested by the user across the UI where it appears (page title and sidebar label), while keeping the existing route path '/mental-performance/life-lessons' unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The Life Lessons page header no longer displays the old label text.
The sidebar navigation label for the Life Lessons route reflects the new name.
The URL path for the page remains '/mental-performance/life-lessons' and navigation to that route continues to work.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing components only).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Backend remains single-actor; no backend changes are required for these UI/layout fixes.
Keep the existing Life Lessons route path '/mental-performance/life-lessons' unchanged.
nonGoals: Adding new video content or changing the motivational video dataset.
Implementing third-party auth providers or any non-Internet Identity authentication.
Backend schema changes or migrations for this request.
